citations.narrative:
The licensee moved to a new location and failed to notify APHIS Animal Care of the change in address. Upon arriving at
the facility, the inspector noticed that the home appeared vacant and the dogs were not observed in the outdoor kennel
areas.
Failure to notify Animal Care of a change in location can make it difficult to verify regulated activities and ensure the
health and wellbeing of regulated animals.
A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days before any change in the name, address, management,
substantial control or ownership of his business or operation, locations, activities, and number or type of animals.
Correct by: September 30, 2025.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:45am on
September 9, 2025. The inspector attempted to contact the licensee by phone and knocked on the house door, but was
unable to reach a facility representative. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a
serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action.
End Section

narrative:
2.1(b)(1) 
   
Requirements and application 
The licensee moved to a new location and failed to notify APHIS Animal Care of the change in address. Upon arriving at 
the facility, the inspector noticed that the home appeared vacant and the dogs were not observed in the outdoor kennel 
areas. 
Failure to notify Animal Care of a change in location can make it difficult to verify regulated activities and ensure the 
health and wellbeing of regulated animals. 
A licensee shall notify Animal Care no fewer than 90 days before any change in the name, address, management, 
substantial control or ownership of his business or operation, locations, activities, and number or type of animals. 
Correct by: September 30, 2025. 
2.126(b) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:45am on 
September 9, 2025. The inspector attempted to contact the licensee by phone and knocked on the house door, but was 
unable to reach a facility representative. Failure to provide access to the facility, animals, and records for inspection is a 
serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result in enforcement action. 
 
 
End Section
